meanings.meaning_en_US: Beautiful; very attractive.

examples.sentence: She wore a [gorgeous] dress to the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她穿了一件華麗的裙子參加活動。

examples.sentence: The sunset was a [gorgeous] sight.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 日落的景色非常美麗。

examples.sentence: He gave her a [gorgeous] bouquet of flowers.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他送給她一束華麗的花束。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To commit oneself to begin a task or responsibility.

examples.sentence: They decided to [undertake] a new project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們決定進行一個新項目

examples.sentence: She will [undertake] the responsibility of managing the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她將承擔管理事件的責任

examples.sentence: It is important to [undertake] necessary safety measures.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 採取必要的安全措施是很重要的

meanings.meaning_en_US: An acknowledgment or expression of gratitude or respect.

examples.sentence: The film is a [tribute] to the legendary director.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這部影片是對這位傳奇導演的致敬

examples.sentence: They paid [tribute] to the fallen soldiers.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們向陣亡士兵致敬

examples.sentence: The concert was a fantastic [tribute] to rock music.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這場音樂會是對搖滾音樂的精彩致敬

meanings.meaning_en_US: A legal agreement in which a bank lends money at interest in exchange for taking title of the debtor’s property, with the condition that the conveyance of title becomes void upon payment of the debt.

examples.sentence: She decided to take out a [mortgage] to buy her first home.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定申請抵押貸款來購買她的第一套房子。

examples.sentence: Understanding the terms of your [mortgage] is crucial.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 了解你抵押貸款的條款是至關重要的。

examples.sentence: The bank has strict policies regarding [mortgage] approvals.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 銀行對於抵押貸款的批准有嚴格的政策。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A practice session for a performance or event before it is presented to an audience.

examples.sentence: The cast gathered for a final [rehearsal] before the opening night.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 演員們在首演前聚集進行最後的彩排。

examples.sentence: She was nervous before the [rehearsal] for her big performance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在她的大型表演排練前，她感到緊張。

examples.sentence: They scheduled a [rehearsal] in the theater two days before the show.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在演出前兩天安排了一次劇院的彩排。

meanings.meaning_en_US: The events that will necessarily happen to a particular person or thing in the future.

examples.sentence: She believed in her [destiny] from a young age.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她從小就相信自己的命運。

examples.sentence: They are trying to change their [destiny].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們試著改變自己的命運。

examples.sentence: His [destiny] seemed preordained.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的命運似乎是注定的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A person who writes for newspapers, magazines, or news websites or prepares news to be broadcast.

examples.sentence: The [journalist] interviewed the politician.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這位記者採訪了這位政治家。

examples.sentence: She is a well-respected [journalist] in her field.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她是其領域內備受尊敬的記者。

examples.sentence: Many [journalists] work under tight deadlines.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多記者在緊迫的截止日期下工作。

meanings.meaning_en_US: An area of land at the back of a house.

examples.sentence: The kids played in the [backyard] all afternoon.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 孩子們整個下午都在後院玩耍。

examples.sentence: She planted flowers in her [backyard].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在後院種了花。

examples.sentence: They set up a barbecue in the [backyard].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在後院搭起了燒烤架。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A person or thing that takes the place or function of another.

examples.sentence: He was used as a [substitute] when the teacher was absent.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當老師缺席時，他被用作替代者。

examples.sentence: I opted for a [substitute] for sugar in my recipe.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我在食譜中選擇了糖的替代品。

examples.sentence: The team found a good [substitute] for their injured player.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 球隊為受傷的球員找到了好替代者。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A part or element of a larger whole.

examples.sentence: Each [component] contributes to the overall performance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每個組成部分都對整體性能有貢獻。

examples.sentence: The engine has several important [components].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這台引擎有幾個重要的元件。

examples.sentence: You need to replace the faulty [component].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你需要更換故障的組成部分。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Relating to a large city or its surrounding communities.

examples.sentence: The [metropolitan] area is known for its diversity.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該大都市區因其多樣性而聞名。

examples.sentence: They moved to a more [metropolitan] lifestyle.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們轉向了更大都市化的生活方式。

examples.sentence: Many [metropolitan] cities offer public transportation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多大城市提供公共交通。

meanings.meaning_en_US: The internal structure that supports the body of a vertebrate.

examples.sentence: The doctor examined the patient's [skeleton].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 醫生檢查了病人的骨架

examples.sentence: A [skeleton] provides support and shape to the body.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 骨架為身體提供支撐和形狀

examples.sentence: The museum displayed a [skeleton] of a dinosaur.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 博物館展出了恐龍的骨架

meanings.meaning_en_US: The action of traveling in or through an unfamiliar area for the purpose of discovery.

examples.sentence: The [exploration] of the ocean is still ongoing.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 對海洋的探索仍在繼續。

examples.sentence: They launched an [exploration] mission to Mars.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們啟動了一個火星探索任務。

examples.sentence: Her [exploration] of different cultures enriched her perspective.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她對不同文化的探索豐富了她的視野。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Easily seen or noticed; clear or apparent.

examples.sentence: There was a [noticeable] change in her attitude.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的態度有明顯的改變。

examples.sentence: He made a [noticeable] effort to improve.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在改進上做出了明顯的努力。

examples.sentence: The speaker's [noticeable] passion captured the audience.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 演講者的明顯熱情吸引了觀眾。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Taking everything into account; generally.

examples.sentence: The project's [overall] progress has been satisfactory.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該項目的總體進展令人滿意。

examples.sentence: In [overall] terms, the results were promising.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在總體上，結果是有希望的。

examples.sentence: Her [overall] performance impressed the judges.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的總體表現給評委留下了深刻的印象。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A way or manner of doing something.

examples.sentence: He switched the camera to portrait [mode].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他將相機切換到肖像模式

examples.sentence: The phone has a silent [mode] for meetings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這部手機有會議靜音模式

examples.sentence: She prefers working in distraction-free [mode].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她更喜歡在無干擾模式下工作

meanings.meaning_en_US: A set of rooms designated for a particular purpose, often used in hotels or residences.

examples.sentence: We booked a luxury [suite] for our vacation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們為假期預訂了一個豪華的套房。

examples.sentence: The hotel offers a spacious [suite] with ocean views.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這家酒店提供一個寬敞的套房，可以俯瞰海洋。

examples.sentence: They moved into a [suite] in the city center.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們搬進了市中心的一個套房。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A written text of a play, film, or broadcast.

examples.sentence: The actor forgot his lines in the [script].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 演員忘記了劇本中的台詞

examples.sentence: She read the [script] before filming began.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在拍攝開始前讀了劇本

examples.sentence: The [script] was well written and engaging.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 劇本寫得很好，吸引人

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make fun of someone or something by imitating them.

examples.sentence: The children began to [mock] the teacher’s voice.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 孩子們開始嘲弄老師的聲音

examples.sentence: They would [mock] their friends playfully.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們會嬉戲地嘲弄朋友

examples.sentence: It’s not nice to [mock] others.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 嘲弄他人是不好的

meanings.meaning_en_US: Deviating from what is normal or usual, typically in a way that is undesirable.

examples.sentence: The doctor noted some [abnormal] tests results.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 醫生注意到一些異常的檢測結果

examples.sentence: Her behavior seemed quite [abnormal] after the incident.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 事件發生後，她的行為看起來相當異常

examples.sentence: In science, [abnormal] phenomena are often investigated.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在科學中，異常現象經常被研究
